title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
A recovery notification bypass vulnerability exists in the userRecoverPass.php captcha validation functionality of WWBN AVideo dev master commit 15fed957fb. A specially crafted HTTP request can lead to silently create a recovery pass code for any user.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50172
  • https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2023-1897
  • https://github.com/WWBN/AVideo/commit/15fed957fb64b4055158acfc449bd7974346edb5
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8m5f-2xvp-2c8w
items.title: [wwbn/avideo] WWBN AVideo recovery notification bypass vulnerability

items.content_html:
It was found that Typo3 Core versions 4.5.0 - 4.5.5 uses prepared statements that, if the parameter values are not properly replaced, could lead to a SQL Injection vulnerability. This issue can only be exploited if two or more parameters are bound to the query and at least two come from user input.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-3583
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2011-3583
  • https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=641682
  • https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-3583
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-core-sa-2011-002/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gx4p-6w86-f8jx
items.title: [typo3/cms] Typo3 SQL injection due to faulty prepared statements

items.content_html:
TYPO3 before 4.3.12, 4.4.x before 4.4.9, and 4.5.x before 4.5.4 allows remote attackers to bypass authentication mechanisms in the backend through a crafted request.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4628
  • https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-4628
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-core-sa-2011-001/#Authentication_Delay_Bypass
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-79gv-5cgx-x6rx
items.title: [typo3/cms] Typo3 Authentication Bypass

items.content_html:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in TYPO3 before 4.3.12, 4.4.x before 4.4.9, and 4.5.x before 4.5.4 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the browse_links wizard.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4630
  • https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-4630
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-core-sa-2011-001/#XSS
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-29wr-24h5-95r5
items.title: [typo3/cms] Typo3 XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in TYPO3 before 4.3.12, 4.4.x before 4.4.9, and 4.5.x before 4.5.4 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the tcemain flash message.

items.content_html:
TYPO3 before 4.5.4 allows Information Disclosure in the backend.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4900
  • https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-4900
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-core-sa-2011-001/#Information_Disclosure
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rwx5-7x5r-jgrm
items.title: [typo3/cms] Typo3 Information Disclosure

items.content_html:
TYPO3 before 4.3.12, 4.4.x before 4.4.9, and 4.5.x before 4.5.4 allows remote attackers to extract arbitrary information from the TYPO3 database.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4901
  • https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-4901
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-core-sa-2011-001/#Information_Disclosure
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8grp-3j5v-543g

items.content_html:
TYPO3 before 4.3.12, 4.4.x before 4.4.9, and 4.5.x before 4.5.4 allows remote attackers to delete arbitrary files on the webserver.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4902
  • https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-4902
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-core-sa-2011-001/#Unserialize

items.title: [typo3/cms] Typo3 Arbitrary File Delete

items.content_html:
TYPO3 before 4.4.9 and 4.5.x before 4.5.4 does not apply proper access control on ExtDirect calls which allows remote attackers to retrieve ExtDirect endpoint services.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4904
  • https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-4904
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-core-sa-2011-001/#Missing_Access_Control
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qf79-34j4-54m6
items.title: [typo3/cms] Typo3 Improper Access Control

items.content_html:
TYPO3 before 4.4.9 and 4.5.x before 4.5.4 does not apply proper access control on ExtDirect calls which allows remote attackers to retrieve ExtDirect endpoint services.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4904
  • https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-4904
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-core-sa-2011-001/#Missing_Access_Control
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qf79-34j4-54m6
items.title: [typo3/cms] Typo3 Improper Access Control
